reviewText: I had seen this concert several times on cable but never got a chance to record it.  Good thing.  The DVD of this concert is excellent.  Especially entertaining were the kids and young adults in the youth orchestra.  Their enthusiasm was infectious and the members of Styx fed off of that.  Visually, the cameras do a good job of showing both the band and orchestra interacting with each other.  From an audio perspective, the recording is just as good.  Great renditions of Styx favorites and a few lesser known but none the less great songs.  Additionally, the orchestra support for the songs was well conceived and really enhanced the performance sound.Under Special Features, there were interviews with each member of the band and two Christmas songs (which were good but seemed a little out of place)Some of us "older" folk may feel todays generation thinks our music is out of date.  Not so.  There's something wonderful about watching two generations interact with each other in such a positive way.  I envoyed every minute.
summary: Great Concert a must have for Styx fans
Title: N/A

reviewText: I finally bought this because my cable company dropped the channel that used to broadcast it every few months.First let me say that the reviewers giving this gem 1 star because they're angry about past band politics don't belong here.This is a great performance in every way. The balance of the audio mix between the band and orchestra instruments is well done, the Blu Ray video quality is excellent and the enthusiasm and talent of the kids can not be denied. This doesn't sound like a band walking in and playing with a bunch of kids it sounds tight and well rehearsed. I'm not sure who wrote the arrangements between band and orchestra but they did a great job.This also contains what I consider to be the best live of performance I Am The Walrus ever recorded. It's perfectly true to the original and was performed so flawlessly even the band was floored.If I had any complaint at all it would be that the surround mix pushes a little too much to the rear immersing you a little too much into the orchestra but that's easily adjusted with a few pushes of my receiver remote.I'd recommend this to anyone who had an interest in Styx's music.
Title: N/A

reviewText: iv"e just viewed for the fourth time styx & the contemporary youth orchestra of cleceland and i"m completly blown away, the kids especially are absotuley great, so full of enthusiasm and eagerness, to perform so brilliantly must have been etched in each ones mind. could not fault it, hey!i"m not leaving styx out of this either, they are a very talented group of musicians and i greatly appreciated rhe whole event. liza grossman you should be awarded a bloody medal for your contribution to the kids neds and desires, it was a pleasure to see everyone on stage light up with a total will to do well, and so they did.  great to see the joy and pride in all those young musicians and singers, it must have been a heartwarming feeling to have performed in this concert, and lets not forget the audience, they all felt the same way by watching them thru this concert. full marks to everyone concerned, orchestra,concert crew etc, job beautifully done. liza grossman i hope you have further works to come of this wonderful young group of people, i"ll certainly be keeping my eyes and ears open, look forward to what may come in the near future
Title: N/A

reviewText: It ain't Styx without Dennis Deyoung.  It's that simple.  I find it highly amusing that this "Shaw Young Band" and all their Dennis bashing fans, would absolutely despise this if Dennis Deyoung did the same thing!  Oh wait, that's right, he did!  In 2003!  So if you'd like to see Styx songs with an orchestra and the original and still best lead singer of Styx, get Dennis Deyoung: The Symphonic Rock music of Styx.  Skip this cover band.  It just absolutely amazes me that the band kicked out their heart and soul leader only to hire a sound alike to do what Dennis would do if he were allowed to!  Why is this acceptable if the Shaw Young Band does it, but generally bashed by the band and their fans if Dennis does/did it?  Why fire your leader and hire a substitute to do the same stuff Dennis was/is doing?  I don't get it.  I'm sure all you fans who think this band is Styx will have a field day with this, but it's my opinion- they stink without Dennis!  (P.S. and get Dennis's CD 100 years from now for the best Styx album in 20 years).
Title: N/A

reviewText: The addition of the orchestra of 171 young musicians gives another dimension to the Styx's sound. This show is like a celebration of Styx's music on a unique concert filmed for posterity. Highlights songs are "One for Everything", who show a more progressive side of the band; the beautiful "Just Be"; the Beatles's song "I am the Walrus" and the medley at the end. There is only one song that i would not have included in the set list and this is "I don't need no doctor", a rather too simplistic song.The Blu-Ray version is quiet spectacular for the great quality of the picture and the beautiful HD surround sound, where you can hear many things clearly with not too much echo, but a really well balanced sound. The band seems to enjoy playing a lot here, with many smiles on their faces.So a must for Styx fans, a good introduction to those who want discover the band, and have a good overview of their long career.
Title: N/A
